name: Absolute Beginner Introduction
level: I've Never Seen a Sewing Machine/I Forgot Everything About This Contraption I Own
description: This is a great start from nothing class or refresh class. I get how it goes, you get a new tool and sometimes it gets put aside because it was rather intimidating or frustrating. No judgement or shade here, I do it allllll the time. For this lesson I will walk you through your sewing machine and we will test out most the settings and check out all the parts. After looking at the machine we'll do some basic sewing with a straight stitch and then make a simple coaster to practice.
req-tools: all the parts that came with your machine

name: Sewing Machine Refresher
description: Has it been a while since you have used you machine? Need a hand getting back into it? I have your back! Whether it is a regular sewing machine or a serger machine we can do a quick run through to get you back on your feet.
req-tools: all the parts that came with your machine

name: Pieced Placemat or Pillowcase
description: Using a traditional disappearing block technique we will piece a top then attach a back making it a pillowcase or placemat. The skills built will include, accurate 1/4" seam allowance, basic quilt piecing
req-materials: 2 colours quilt cotton - 1/4m (or fat quarter) each.
White all purpose or light to medium grey thread.

name: Simple Shirt
description: Learn to sew a simple, loose-fitting shirt with minimal shaping. Perfect for beginners looking to create their first wearable garment!
req-materials: Lightweight woven fabric (like cotton lawn or voile)

name: PJ Pants
description: Sew a comfy pair of pajama pants and learn the basics of working with patterns, seams, and elastic waistbands.

name: First Project
description: Brand new to sewing? This first project class is designed to ease you in with a small, confidence-building project like a tote bag or drawstring pouch.
req-materials: Optional: ribbon or cord for drawstring

name: First Time With Knit Fabric
description: Curious about sewing with stretchy fabric? This class walks you through the basics of handling knits and making a simple project like a t-shirt or headband.
req-materials: Cotton jersey or interlock knit fabric

name: Beginner Quilt Top
description: Start your quilting journey by learning to piece a simple quilt top. We'll cover cutting, layout, and accurate seams.

name: Quilted Table Runner
description: Make a stylish quilted table runner from start to finish. You'll piece, quilt, and bind in one class session.

name: Common Pant Adjustments
level: Intermediate – Familiar with Sewing and Basic Garment Construction
description: Are you having trouble getting those pants to fit right? I have had this problem over and over again. Because of this I've gotten myself pretty experienced in the adjustments for pants to get them looking right and I'm happy to pass on my knowledge to you.

name: Sewer's Choice Project
description: This is a choose-your-own-adventure style class where you bring a project you're working on or want to start, and I’ll help you with whatever part you’re stuck on—or just be a sewing buddy if you want accountability! This class is great for folks who want guidance on a specific garment, technique, or pattern but don’t need a full lesson plan. I’ll tailor my help to your skill level and goals. Let’s get that UFO (UnFinished Object) moving or help you try something new with confidence.
req-materials: Pattern and fabric for your project
Any notions listed on your pattern
req-tools: all necessary presser feet and accessories
any pattern instructions or reference material

name: First Intermediate Garment
description: You’ve tackled a few beginner projects, maybe some pajama pants or a simple top—and now you’re ready for more! This class is designed to help you make your first intermediate-level garment with confidence. We'll choose a pattern together beforehand (or bring one you have in mind), and I’ll guide you through trickier steps like setting in sleeves, inserting a zipper, or working with facings. It’s all about building your skills and understanding garment construction in a supportive environment.
req-materials: Fabric and notions as listed on the pattern
